title: Third victim reportedly dies after Pawtucket ice rink shooting
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Gerald Dorgan, 75, died after being hospitalized following the February 16 shooting at Dennis M. Lynch Arena in Pawtucket.
The shooter, Robert Dorgan, killed his ex-wife, Rhonda Dorgan, and their son before dying by self-inflicted gunshot.
A GoFundMe page was established for surviving family members Ava Dorgan and a 17-year-old high school senior.

title: Cat saved after days stuck in a tree following the blizzard that blanketed Rhode Island
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Matt Lyons rescued Pixie, a cat stuck 50 feet high for two days during Rhode Island's historic snowstorm.
Neighbors' attempts failed, and local authorities advised contacting tree services; Lyons saw the situation on Nextdoor.
Pixie is safely back with her owner after Lyons climbed the tree and carried her down in his sweatshirt.

title: 4 questions facing Bruins as they return from Olympic break
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins to play 25 games in eight weeks, starting against Columbus Blue Jackets at TD Garden.
Bruins sit in second Wild Card spot; they have a 32-20-5 record with 69 points in the Eastern Conference.
Key focuses include addressing penalty issues, trade deadline decisions, and integrating prospects like James Hagens.

title: Fire erupts at MCI-Norfolk prison, no major injuries reported
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Fire at MCI-Norfolk prison in Massachusetts extinguished with no major injuries reported.
Three incarcerated individuals treated for smoke inhalation; one staff member hospitalized as a precaution.
Authorities investigating fire cause and assessing damage at the state's largest medium-security prison.

title: Stephen A. Smith endorses Jaylen Brown as an MVP candidate
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Stephen A. Smith endorses Jaylen Brown as a strong MVP candidate during the Celtics' 2025-26 season.
Jaylen Brown averages 29.2 points, 7.0 rebounds, and 4.9 assists, leading the Celtics in Jayson Tatum's absence.
Celtics rank second in the Eastern Conference at 38-19 despite losing key players in the offseason.

title: Harvard professor on leave as college investigates ties to Jeffrey Epstein
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Harvard placed Professor Martin Nowak on leave amid an investigation into ties with Jeffrey Epstein, following DOJ document releases.
Nowak's Program for Evolutionary Dynamics at Harvard received $6.5 million from Epstein for establishment in 2003.
Epstein visited Nowak's workplace over 40 times; Nowak also visited Epstein's island in 2013, per DOJ documents.

title: Malden educator, basketball coach charged with rape in incident involving high school student, officials say
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Malden educator and coach Scott Marino charged with rape, indecent assault, and selling liquor to a minor.
The alleged incident involved a Malden High School student and occurred outside of working hours.
Stoneham police arrested Marino; the Middlesex District Attorney's Office is handling the prosecution.

title: Red Sox’ Wilyer Abreu explains viral broken-bat check swing
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Wilyer Abreu's bat broke during a check swing in a spring-training game against the Pirates.
Abreu suspects the bat was compromised earlier but opted not to switch it before the bizarre break.
Abreu is expected to deliver strong performances in 2026 after hitting 22 home runs in 115 games last season.

title: All Mass. customers should have power fully restored by end of Friday night, Eversource says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Eversource plans to restore power by midnight Friday to Eastern Mass. areas affected by Monday's blizzard.
160,000 customers are still without power, with 121,000 on Cape Cod and Martha's Vineyard, and 40,000 in Plymouth and New Bedford.
National Grid reported 3,000 outages on Nantucket as of Wednesday night, aiming for full restoration by Wednesday 11 p.m.

title: Team USA captain Hilary Knight reacts to Trump’s ‘distasteful’ joke about U.S. women’s hockey team
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Team USA's Hilary Knight called President Trump's joke about the women's hockey team 'distasteful' after their Olympic gold win.
The U.S. women's team declined Trump's invitation to his State of the Union address due to prior commitments.
U.S. men's hockey team expressed regret over their reaction to Trump's joke, highlighting respect for the women's achievements.
